title: Create bootstrap details command for optional verbose output
description: Create a 'show bootstrap details' command that displays the full verbose information about a bootstrap operation (complete file list, template reasoning, configuration decisions, all commands, structure diagram). This information is hidden from the default completion message but available on demand, supporting the tiered information display approach.
notes: LOW IMPACT - Additional Support. Complements task 90 (tiered information display). Provides drill-down capability for users who want full details.
user_benefit: Users who want detailed information can access it without cluttering the default experience
completion_notes:
Created comprehensive show-bootstrap-details.md command file that displays:
- Template selection reasoning with confidence bars and alternatives
- Configuration summary with difficulty system, Phase 0 status, complexity level
- Complete file structure tree with counts
- Initial tasks created (if any)
- Detailed next steps workflow (Phase 0 for Power Query, standard for others)
- Quick reference section with commands and key files

The command follows patterns from show-commands.md and provides:
- Visual formatting with ASCII art (bars, trees, separators)
- Educational content about template selection
- Graceful handling of missing information
- Clear immediate next action
- Read-only operation (no file modifications)

Two detailed examples provided:
1. Power Query project with Phase 0 workflow
2. Simple Base template project

File: .claude/commands/show-bootstrap-details.md (approximately 650 lines)
